%md
## Please note this is Part 2 of the Graph Algorithm to-date in SciSpark.
If you missed Part 1, we encourage you to run that notebook **FIRST** as there are variable dependencies!


![The major steps of the GTG](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SciSpark/scispark_zeppelin_notebooks/master/images/GTGSteps.png)                          
               Figure 1: The major steps of the the Grab 'em, Tag 'em, Graph 'em algorithm
               
####Useful references
* Palamuttam, R., R. Marroquín Mogrovejo, C. Mattmann, B. Wilson, K. Whitehall, R. Verma, L. McGibbney, and P. Ramirez, 2015. SciSpark: Applying In-memory Distributed Computing to Weather Event Detection and Tracking. In 2015 IEEE International Conference on Big Data (Big Data) on, pp. 1959 - 1965.

* Whitehall, K., C. Mattmann, G. Jenkins, M. Rwebangira, B. Demoz, D.  Waliser, J. Kim, C. Goodale, A. Hart, P. Ramirez, M. Joyce, M. Boustani, P. Zimdars, P. Loikith, and H. Lee, 2014. Exploring a graph theory based algorithm for automated identification and characterization of large mesoscale convective systems in satellite datasets. Earth Science Informatics. DOI: 10.1007/s12145-014-0181-3

paragraphs.text:
%md 
## Find the subgraphs
These subgraphs physically identify the cloudy areas that have evolve in time
Right now we are reading the edgeList from a file which has to send to HDFS 
There is a bit of cleaning of the file to be done before moving to HDFS. More specifically, remove 'List(' from the beginning of the file and last ')' at the end of the file (these are from converting the List so as to print the outputs into the file).
Once this is done, the subgraphs part can be run. 

Our graph (the data object representing all the cloud elements and their connectivity through out the start and end times):
* Sparse, disconnected and directed. 
* There are no cycles

Our initial approach to determine all the connected subgraphs within this graph is:
* Partition nodes such that possible connected nodes are together
* On each partition: eliminate only subgraphs that are found in that partition 
* Merge consecutive partitions and repeat subgraph elimination
* Continue until one partition remains OR all nodes are gone

Our approach ensures a maximum number of iterations of log(paritions)/log(2) + 1

Outstanding TODOs:
* continued testing
* allowing to read the edgelist directly from the RDD (ie. eliminate the text writing part)

result.msg:
Find the subgraphs

These subgraphs physically identify the cloudy areas that have evolve in time
Right now we are reading the edgeList from a file which has to send to HDFS
There is a bit of cleaning of the file to be done before moving to HDFS. More specifically, remove 'List(' from the beginning of the file and last ')' at the end of the file (these are from converting the List so as to print the outputs into the file).
Once this is done, the subgraphs part can be run.

Our graph (the data object representing all the cloud elements and their connectivity through out the start and end times):

  • Sparse, disconnected and directed.
  • There are no cycles

Our initial approach to determine all the connected subgraphs within this graph is:

  • Partition nodes such that possible connected nodes are together
  • On each partition: eliminate only subgraphs that are found in that partition
  • Merge consecutive partitions and repeat subgraph elimination
  • Continue until one partition remains OR all nodes are gone

Our approach ensures a maximum number of iterations of log(paritions)/log(2) + 1

Outstanding TODOs:

  • continued testing
  • allowing to read the edgelist directly from the RDD (ie. eliminate the text writing part)

paragraphs.text:
val edgesRDDn = sc.parallelize(MCCEdgeList).map({ x => s"((${x.srcNode.frameNum}, ${x.srcNode.cloudElemNum}),(${x.destNode.frameNum}, ${x.destNode.cloudElemNum}))"})

val subGraphsCountn = edgesRDDn.map({x =>{
    val bins: Int = 8
    val frames: Int = 40
    val frameBucketSize: Float = frames / bins // Number of frames in each bucket, here its 5
    val minAcceptableFeatureLength = 3
    val maxIterations = scala.math.ceil(scala.math.log(bins)/scala.math.log(2)) + 1
    
    val nodes1 = x.split("\\),\\(")
    val source = nodes1(0).slice(2, nodes1(0).length).split(",") // (FrameNum, CloudElemNum)
    val dest = nodes1(1).slice(0, nodes1(1).length - 2).split(",") // (FrameNum, CloudElemNum)
    val nodeMap = new mutable.HashMap[String, MCCNode]()
    val sourceFrameNum = x.slice(2, x.indexOfSlice(",")).toInt
    val sourceKey = source(0) + source(1)
    val destKey = dest(0) + dest(1)
    
    if (!nodeMap.contains(sourceKey)) { // Add node to nodeMap if not present 
      nodeMap.put(sourceKey, new MCCNode(source(0).toInt, source(1).toFloat))
    }
    if (!nodeMap.contains(destKey)) {
      nodeMap.put(destKey, new MCCNode(dest(0).toInt, dest(1).toFloat))
    }
    val sourceNode: MCCNode = nodeMap.get(sourceKey).get
    val destNode = nodeMap.get(destKey).get

    for (i <- 1 to bins) {
      if (sourceFrameNum <= frameBucketSize * i) { // Finding the bucket to put this edge into
        val bucket: Integer = i
        (bucket,new MCCEdge(sourceNode, destNode)) // return the bucket number and a new edge
      }
    }
     (java.lang.Integer.valueOf(bins), new MCCEdge(sourceNode, destNode)) // put edge highest bucket number
}}).groupByKey() // group by key to get all edges in one bucket together
MainDistGraphMCC.getSubgraphs(subGraphsCountn, 1) // call recursive subgraph finding code

paragraphs.title: transfer data to the Python environment
Scala functions for visualization
paragraphs.text:
import scala.collection.mutable.ListBuffer
import java.util
import ucar.ma2.{Array, ArrayInt, ArrayDouble, DataType}
import ucar.nc2.{NetcdfFileWriter, Dimension, Attribute, Variable }
import scala.reflect.ClassTag
import scala.collection.JavaConversions._
import collection.mutable._

def netcdf_write(filename:String, varData:ucar.ma2.ArrayInt.D2){
    import java.util
    import ucar.ma2.{ArrayInt, ArrayDouble, DataType}
    import ucar.nc2.{NetcdfFileWriter, Dimension, Attribute, Variable }
    import scala.reflect.ClassTag
    import scala.collection.JavaConversions._
    import collection.mutable._

    try{
        val latsa = (-5.006254987 to 40.000360884 by 0.036378335).toList  
        val lonsa = (-90.018179125 to 60.006074415 by 0.036378335).toList
        
        val fsplit = filename.split("_")
        val latMin = fsplit(1).toInt 
        val latMax = fsplit(2).toInt 
        val lonMin = fsplit(3).toInt 
        val lonMax = fsplit(4).dropRight(3).toInt  
        
        val lats1 = latsa.slice(latMin, latMax+1)
        val lons1 = lonsa.slice(lonMin, lonMax+1)
        
        val location = "/home/workshop/cenetcdfs/"+filename 
        val datafile = NetcdfFileWriter.createNew(NetcdfFileWriter.Version.netcdf3, location, null)
        
        // Create netCDF dimensions
        val lonDim = datafile.addDimension(null, "longitudes", lons1.length)
        val latDim = datafile.addDimension(null, "latitudes", lats1.length)
        
        // add dim
        val dims = new util.ArrayList[Dimension]()
        val latDims = new util.ArrayList[Dimension]()
        val lonDims = new util.ArrayList[Dimension]()
        
        // dims.add(xDim) 
        dims.add(latDim)
        dims.add(lonDim)
        
        latDims.add(latDim)
        lonDims.add(lonDim)
        
        var rr = datafile.addVariable(null, "CE brightness temperature", DataType.INT, dims)
        var latDimVar = datafile.addVariable(null, "lat", DataType.DOUBLE, latDims)
        var lonDimVar = datafile.addVariable(null, "lon", DataType.DOUBLE, lonDims)
        
        rr.addAttribute(new Attribute("units", "K"))   
        
        val latData = new ArrayDouble.D1(lats1.length)
        val lonData = new ArrayDouble.D1(lons1.length)
        
        for (i <- 0 until lats1.length) { latData.set(i, lats1(i))}
        for (i <- 0 until lons1.length) { lonData.set(i, lons1(i))}
   
        datafile.create()
        datafile.write(rr, varData)
        datafile.write(latDimVar, latData)
        datafile.write(lonDimVar, lonData)
       
        datafile.close()
    }
}

//generate netcdf files for the relevant nodes
val sg2n = sg1n.collect()

sg2n.map({ e => 
    import ucar.ma2.{Array, ArrayDouble, DataType}
    
    var seenNodes = new ListBuffer[String]()
    var nodeID = ""
    var latMin =.0
    var latMax =.0
    var lonMin =.0
    var lonMax =.0
    var lonMinOffset = 0
    var lonMaxOffset = 0
    var latMinOffset = 0
    var latMaxOffset = 0
    
    val lats = (-5.006254987 to 40.000360884 by 0.036378335).toList  
    val lons = (-90.018179125 to 60.006074415 by 0.036378335).toList
    
    var nodeGrid = new ArrayInt.D2(1238, 4125)
    var ima = nodeGrid.getIndex()
    val first = e._1.split("CE")(0).split("F")(1)+","+e._1.split("CE")(1).dropRight(2)+".0"
    
    if (!seenNodes.contains(first)){
        seenNodes += first
        val fNode = MCCNodeMap.get(first).get
        
        //get lat-lon box here
        val props1 = fNode.metadata.get("properties").getOrElse().asInstanceOf[mutable.HashMap[String, Double]]
        latMin = lats.minBy(v => math.abs( v - (props1.get("latMin").get)))
        latMax = lats.minBy(v => math.abs( v - (props1.get("latMax").get)))
        lonMin = lons.minBy(v => math.abs( v - (props1.get("lonMin").get)))
        lonMax = lons.minBy(v => math.abs( v - (props1.get("lonMax").get)))
        
        latMinOffset = lats.indexOf(latMin)
        latMaxOffset = lats.indexOf(latMax)
        lonMinOffset = lons.indexOf(lonMin)
        lonMaxOffset = lons.indexOf(lonMax)
        
        nodeGrid = new ArrayInt.D2(((latMaxOffset-latMinOffset)+1), ((lonMaxOffset-lonMinOffset)+1))
        ima = nodeGrid.getIndex()
        
        val gridMap: mutable.HashMap[String, Double] = fNode.metadata.get("grid")
          .getOrElse().asInstanceOf[mutable.HashMap[String, Double]]
        gridMap.foreach{case(k,v) => {
            val indices = k.replace("(", "").replace(")","").replace(" ", "").split(",")
            nodeGrid.setDouble(ima.set( (indices(0).toInt) - latMinOffset, (indices(1).toInt) - lonMinOffset), v.toInt)
        }}
    
        nodeID = "F"+fNode.frameNum.toString+"CE"+fNode.cloudElemNum.toString.dropRight(2)+"_"+latMinOffset+"_"+latMaxOffset+"_"+lonMinOffset+"_"+lonMaxOffset+".nc"
        netcdf_write(nodeID, nodeGrid)
    }
    
    val second = e._2.split("CE")(0).split("F")(1)+","+e._2.split("CE")(1).dropRight(1)+".0"
                 
    if (!seenNodes.contains(second)){
        seenNodes += second
        val sNode = MCCNodeMap.get(second).get
    
        //get lat-lon box here
        val props2 = sNode.metadata.get("properties").getOrElse().asInstanceOf[mutable.HashMap[String, Double]]
        latMin = lats.minBy(v => math.abs( v - (props2.get("latMin").get)))
        latMax = lats.minBy(v => math.abs( v - (props2.get("latMax").get)))
        lonMin = lons.minBy(v => math.abs( v - (props2.get("lonMin").get)))
        lonMax = lons.minBy(v => math.abs( v - (props2.get("lonMax").get)))
        
        latMinOffset = lats.indexOf(latMin)
        latMaxOffset = lats.indexOf(latMax)
        lonMinOffset = lons.indexOf(lonMin)
        lonMaxOffset = lons.indexOf(lonMax)
        
        nodeGrid = new ArrayInt.D2(((latMaxOffset-latMinOffset)+1), ((lonMaxOffset-lonMinOffset)+1))
        ima = nodeGrid.getIndex()
        
        val gridMap: mutable.HashMap[String, Double] = sNode.metadata.get("grid")
          .getOrElse().asInstanceOf[mutable.HashMap[String, Double]]
        gridMap.foreach{case(k,v) => {
            val indices = k.replace("(", "").replace(")","").replace(" ", "").split(",")
            nodeGrid.setDouble(ima.set( (indices(0).toInt) - latMinOffset, (indices(1).toInt) - lonMinOffset), v.toInt)
        }}
    
        nodeID = "F"+sNode.frameNum.toString+"CE"+sNode.cloudElemNum.toString.dropRight(2)+"_"+latMinOffset+"_"+latMaxOffset+"_"+lonMinOffset+"_"+lonMaxOffset+".nc"
        netcdf_write(nodeID, nodeGrid)
    }
    
})

%pyspark
#create pngs
import os, sys, glob

def make_imgs(currFile):
    import numpy as np
    import os, sys
    import subprocess
    import matplotlib
    matplotlib.use('Agg')
    #os.system("export DISPLAY=:0") 
    
    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
    plt.rcdefaults()
    
    import cStringIO
    import base64
    from mpl_toolkits.basemap import Basemap, cm
    
    from netCDF4 import Dataset
    
    workdir = ''.join('/'+e for e in currFile.split('/')[1:-1])
    
    fh = Dataset(currFile, 'r')
    fhlats = fh.variables['lat'][:]
    fhlons = fh.variables['lon'][:]
    fhbt = fh.variables['CE_brightness_temperature'][:]
    fh.close()
    
    lon1, lat1 = np.meshgrid(fhlons, fhlats)
    
    cmap = matplotlib.cm.jet_r
    plt.figure(figsize=(3,2))

    mp = Basemap(projection = 'merc', llcrnrlon = min(fhlons), urcrnrlon = max(fhlons), llcrnrlat = min(fhlats), urcrnrlat = max(fhlats), resolution = 'l')
    x1, y1 = mp(lon1, lat1)
    clevs1 = range(96,250,5)
    cs1 = mp.contourf(x1, y1, fhbt, clevs1, cmap=cmap)
    
    # Add Grid Lines
    mp.drawparallels(np.arange(-6., 45., 10.), labels=[1,0,0,0], fontsize=8)
    mp.drawmeridians(np.arange(-95., 65., 20.), labels=[0,0,0,1], fontsize=8)
    
    mp.drawcoastlines(linewidth = 0.25)
    mp.drawcountries(linewidth = 0.25)
    
    # Add Colorbar
    cbar1 = mp.colorbar(cs1, cmap=cmap, location='bottom', pad="30%", ticks=clevs1 )
    cbar1.set_label("Brightness Temp in K")
    
    # Add Title
    ti = currFile.split('/')[-1].split('_')[0]
    plt.title(ti)
    plt.savefig(workdir+'pngs/'+ti+'.png')
    
    plt.close()
   
# get the list of the netCDFs generates
workdir = '/home/workshop/cenetcdfs/'

ceLists = glob.glob(workdir+'*.nc')
if not os.path.exists(workdir+'pngs/'):
    os.makedirs(workdir+'pngs/')
    
for t in ceLists:
    make_imgs(t)
